etymology.description: 没(not have/without) + 事(matter/affair) = no matter; nothing wrong; be free.
etymology.interpretation: Common reassurance meaning “it’s fine” or “no problem,” and by extension “nothing going on” → “I’m free.” Often used to downplay issues or to say one is unoccupied.
etymology.simplification: 沒 was simplified to 没 by streamlining the right-hand component and reducing strokes for a high‑frequency negator; 事 stayed the same.

parts.english: not have; without; not; to sink

examples.chinese: 你明天没事吗(你明天沒事嗎)？
别担心(別擔心)，没事(沒事)。
